headline: Senior Software Engineer & Tech Manager | Product-focused | Product & Tech Strategy | Agile Mindset | +10 years leading teams and digital products
about:
Ingeniero de software con más de 10 años de experiencia liderando equipos, diseñando plataformas escalables y entregando productos digitales en entornos de alto crecimiento. He trabajado como CTO, Head of Development, Team Lead y Senior Engineer, combinando dirección técnica con participación activa en el desarrollo.

A lo largo de mi carrera he gestionado equipos multidisciplinares, definido arquitecturas, impulsado buenas prácticas, acompañado procesos de modernización tecnológica y contribuido a que productos reales evolucionen de forma sólida y sostenible. Tengo experiencia en stacks basados en PHP, Symfony, PostgreSQL y AWS, además de un enfoque claro hacia la calidad, la automatización y la escalabilidad.

En los últimos años he incorporado el uso de IA aplicada para potenciar procesos y productos, integrando LLMs y agentes cuando aportan valor real y mejoran la eficiencia de los equipos y las soluciones. Forma parte de mi evolución natural como ingeniero y de mi interés por explorar nuevas formas de construir software.

Me interesa formar parte de equipos con visión de producto, donde pueda aportar mi combinación de experiencia técnica, liderazgo y capacidad para entregar soluciones prácticas con impacto real.

recommendations.name: Mireia Mateu
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Product Manager - Cognitive Knowledge Manager
recommendations.context: Jordi worked with Mireia but on different teams
recommendations.description:
Conocí a Mireia trabajando en LetsBonus, y por su cercanía y carácter extrovertido, hacen que desde el primer minuto se convierta en una de las mejores compañeras de trabajo que cualquiera desearía tener en su departamento y empresa.

Entre sus habilidades interpersonales cabe destacar el entusiasmo y la pasión en todo lo que hace, no sólo profesionalmente, y por supuesto sus grandes cualidades sociales y humanas, que hacen de ella una persona sincera y amiga, de trato sencillo, familiar y directo, con una relación que fácilmente se transforma en amistad.

Profesionalmente he trabajado con ella en diversos proyectos de Social Media, y todos ellos han llegado a buen puerto gracias a su capacidad de liderazgo y de encontrar y proponer soluciones fáciles a los problemas complejos que se presentaron. Su inquietud como emprendedora, la hacen especialista y conocedora de todos los nuevos proyectos en internet, tanto nacionales como internacionales, proporcionando al equipo un infinito abanico de conocimientos, recursos y contactos.

Innovadora e inquieta, sabe aportar ese plus de experiencia en la planificación de estrategias para alcanzar resultados medibles, eficientes, ajustados a la realidad del proyecto, de las herramientas y tecnología seleccionadas y de marcar unos objetivos claramente definidos. Todo esto la convierte en una persona capaz de liderar cualquier tipo de proyecto, contagiando al resto de personas su perseverancia, optimismo y conocimientos.

En mi experiencia trabajando junto a ella, fue especialmente decisiva su participación, en proyectos como la implantación de Facebook Connect, donde diseñó toda la estrategia de implantación, captación de leads a través de Facebook y lideró de forma activa todo el proyecto junto al equipo técnico. También fue decisivo su trabajo en la migración de las fan pages de Facebook, donde se fusionaron decenas de páginas y hubo que coordinarse con el equipo técnico de Facebook y el equipo técnico de LetsBonus.

Su aportación para crear acciones vía Twitter tanto comunicaciones como concursos, sorteos o promociones era fundamental, para los cuales se planificaban y coordinaban previamente estrategias, herramientas y posibles implicaciones junto al equipo técnico.

Además de esto, eran especialmente productivos los distintos brainstormings a los que asistía junto a ella y que se realizaban periódicamente, y a partir de los cuales se materializaban acciones, estrategias y futuras planificaciones. Su visión en este sentido es abrumadora, capaz de adelantarse y predecir nuevas y mejores estrategias, no sólo en redes sociales, también en web.

Carismática, ganadora, siempre atenta a todos los detalles, profesional, viajera incansable (si hay algun lugar que no conozca es porque probablemente no exista), enérgica, innovadora, líder, entusiasta, trabajadora, proactiva, fuente inagotable de recursos... es imprescindible para cualquier proyecto, ella es sinónimo de garantía.

headline: Entrepreneur, CTO, Advisor

experiences.title: CTO & Cofounder
experiences.jobDescription:
DataFox (acquired by Oracle in October 2018) is a company intelligence platform that helps you find and prioritize target companies to source more opportunities.

Our machine learning algorithms and human analysts verify proprietary insights on millions of businesses to provide robust company data and growth signals.  We are backed by Goldman Sachs, Green Visor, Google Ventures, and Slack, and used by high-growth startups and Fortune 500 companies alike, including UPS, Visa, Twilio, and Zendesk.

As CTO I managed product, engineering, design, and operations teams and own security & compliance.

Since the acquisition I was Sr Director Development at Oracle working to integrate the product and team.

experiences.title: Staff Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
As a staff engineer I focused on tackling our biggest technical problems in our core code and frameworks.

* I led the creation of a "frameworks" team staffed by our most senior engineers to focus on refactoring and scaling the core code that power Box.  As an example project, I led a 3 month project to eliminate technical debt from our permissioning system, resulting in modular code with 100% unit test coverage.  
* I next rotated to our highest priority project to improve our desktop sync tool where I designed and led a scalable "canary" deployment system, and built cross-platform support.
* As a technical leader I actively mentored 7 junior engineers, advised multiple large projects outside my team, and actively participated in cross-engineering technical advisory groups.  I introduced and evangelized best-practice processes and tools; for example, I converted our 150-engineer organization to an IDE (from Vim) to improve quality and productivity.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
As a software engineer, I worked on literally every aspect of the codebase from backend scaling to frontend features, with a focus on clean code and clear architecture.

* Built end-to-end features in Java, Flash, JS/CSS + LAMP (PHP)
* Helped lead a site redesign project that rewrote all frontend CSS to be modular and consistent.
* Owned our uploading infrastructure and introduced testing and logging to this core system.
* Drove our DB sharding project to transition from a monolithic MySQL database to a horizontally-scalable sharded architecture capable of hot-swapping and re-sharding on the fly without downtime.  To complete the project on time and without incidents, I built our sharding frameworks and ported over legacy code across the entire codebase.
* Designed and built core frameworks, and drove their adoption across the engineering organization.

updates.postText:
3 technologies your MVP should NOT use

1. Kubernetes
2. Serverless
3. NoSQL

Not using them will save you time to market and money.

---

[1] Great technology, but overkill to an MVP. To be honest, it's overkill for 90% of post-MVP projects.

[2] It seems a good idea at first, especially on the cost side. But it becomes a challenge (testing, synchronizing, running locally, etc).

[3] Often pitched as "easy to change our data". Most MVPs could be simplified by using PostgreSQL or MySQL.

Microservices in an early-stage company is a huge mistake

- they slow down development
- they are more prone to bugs
- they are complex
- they are expensive

A well-structured monolith is a way better option

- fewer moving parts: easier to develop and iterate
- less infrastructure to run: lower costs
- simplicity: less chance of bugs

---

P.S. Are you planning to use (or already struggling) with microservices? Want a second opinion?

Write "free call" in the comments. 
I'll send you an invite to a FREE call.

recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Technical Project Manager
recommendationsReceived.context: Katherine reported directly to Ferran
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the privilege of working under Ferran at Moonshot Partners for over three years, and I can confidently say he is an exemplary leader and mentor. His expertise in project management is unparalleled. He consistently delivered complex projects on time and within budget, demonstrating exceptional organizational skills and a deep understanding of our industry's nuances.

What truly sets Ferran apart is his problem-solving mentality. No challenge was too great for him; he approached each one with a strategic mindset and a calm demeanor, always finding innovative solutions that propelled our projects forward. His ability to think critically and remain composed under pressure was a constant source of inspiration for our team.

In addition to his professional acumen, Ferran is an outstanding mentor. He took the time to guide and support each team member, fostering an environment of growth and continuous learning. His kindness and genuine care for his colleagues created a positive and collaborative work atmosphere, making Moonshot Partners not just a workplace, but a community.

I highly recommend Ferran for any Senior Project Management role. His blend of expertise, problem-solving skills, and empathetic leadership make him an invaluable asset to any organization.

recommendationsReceived.name: Nicolás Silveira
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Systems Engineer | Data & BI Engineering
recommendationsReceived.context: Nicolás reported directly to Ferran
recommendationsReceived.description:
During my time at Moonshot Partners, I had the pleasure to work under the management of Ferran throughout several projects. During this time, I was able to witness his ability to directly interact with clients, manage an entire team and rigorously set expectations, timeframes and goals.

His technical background allows him to empathize with team members and grants him the ability to set realistic expectations for everyone. Moreover, he has proven to be very knowledgeable in the art of agile and its rituals, where he is constantly able to strike a balance between following them religiously and granting the required flexibility to adapt periodically to the flow of the project.

In situations that would put the team under pressure, Ferran demonstrated his aptitude and professionalism through quick decision-making, but, most importantly, he rapidly became a beacon of guidance to whom anyone could express frustrations, blockers or any other issue. Instead of being punished or scolded for mistakes, his approach would be aimed at finding solutions, quickly addressing blockers and keeping the pressure of the environment under control.

Finally, something that always stood out to me was how focused he was on the people that were assigned under him and their proffesional growth. Ferran constantly took the time and effort of checking on team members periodically, helping them trace and update career development paths and define strategies to meet their goals. Such levels of attention and attentiveness are, to me, praiseworthy and something that every team should strive to have in a professional setting.

For the reasons stated above, I can wholeheartdely recommend Ferran as a professional who will, without a doubt, bring to the table great management skills, a strong technical background and the ability to manage and push teams and projects forward.

headline: Board Member, Technology Executive
about:
Kimber Lockhart is a board member at Beam Technologies and advisor at a variety of growth stage health tech companies. She is the former CTO of innovative health care company One Medical (NASDAQ: ONEM).  She is experienced leading growth-stage teams in software engineering, product management, design, support, IT and security -- focused on delivering a top-notch user experience in highly regulated spaces.

She speaks widely on building and scaling teams, with a focus on crafting culture, developing leaders and effectively addressing technical debt.  

Previously, Kimber co-founded Increo Solutions, a document collaboration company that was acquired by Box in 2009.  She served in a variety of roles in engineering leadership at Box (NYSE: BOX).

Defined and grew the web application engineering team at Box (50 FTEs, $10M budget). 
Oversaw new frontend and application tier architectures and a full rewrite of the legacy frontend system.
Developed key features for Box’s transition to Fortune 100 enterprise customers including central file management, DLP, and robust permissioning.

Defined cross-organization processes for hiring, onboarding and performance expectations senior engineering talent.

updates.postText:
2 years already!!!! I feel thankful. 🎉 🙂

This week 2 years ago, I joined a small startup, Loyal Guru , which also brought me the opportunity to finish my adventure of living and working abroad and come back home, Barcelona (the city for creativity and innovation).

Now… I look back, and the startup I joined is 3x bigger!! So the Product Management style and work I had to contribute have continuously evolved. Can you imagine the challenge, but the opportunity??!!! 😬 Once you think you nailed it…then is time to adapt it again, not good enough. Such a ride. And what comes for 2023 is even more exciting!

This is the magic of good and cool Product Management, the "non-stop". I just can add that working in pure Product Management for almost 9 years taught me something, there is no perfect formula, perfect book, or perfect framework. The more you experience and the more you try then the more you learn, just keep evolving and tweaking the sails, but NEVER stop sailing ( yep… really into⛵ 🙃 ). 

Shaping a great product that scales requires attention to many variables. But what I am glad about today, is not what I know from my experiences, it is what my team challenge and question every day because when they do, they teach me and we all learn, and that's why our product is all set for success.

So... Building products that scale is COOL 😎 👨‍💻!!! Happy Friday!

Take away: Stop, breathe, look back and check where you came from. Understand what brought you here and the decisions you made. 

#innovation #productmanagement #startup

I am a work package leader of a large EU funded project – Mont-Blanc2 2013-2016. The Mont-Blanc project explores how to build large supercomputers from commodity and low-power embedded processors that are used in today's handled devices such as smartphones. The project has 13 partners and 11.4 Million Euros funding. 

The work package that I lead is about resiliency and fault tolerance in high performance systems like the Mont-Blanc prototype supercomputer. My management responsibilities as a work package leader are to coordinate and align the work between other work packages as well as among the partners within the work package which I lead. My technical responsibilities include memory reliability characterization of the Mont-Blanc prototype system; proposal, development and evaluation of complementary fault-tolerance techniques both in SW and HW that would improve the overall system's reliability.

publications.title: dReDBox: Materializing a full-stack rack-scale system prototype of a next-generation disaggregated datacenter
publications.source: DATE'2018: Design, Automation & Test in Europe Conference & Exhibition
publications.summary: Current datacenters are based on server machines, whose mainboard and hardware components form the baseline, monolithic building block that the rest of the system software, middleware and application stack are built upon. This leads to the following limitations: (a) resource proportionality of a multi-tray system is bounded by the basic building block (mainboard), (b) resource allocation to processes or virtual machines (VMs) is bounded by the available resources within the boundary of the mainboard, leading to spare resource fragmentation and inefficiencies, and (c) upgrades must be applied to each and every server even when only a specific component needs to be upgraded. The dRedBox project (Disaggregated Recursive Datacentre-in-a-Box) addresses the above limitations, and proposes the next generation, low-power, across form-factor datacenters, departing from the paradigm of the mainboard-as-a-unit and enabling the creation of function-block-as-a-unit. Hardware-level disaggregation and software-defined wiring of resources is supported by a full-fledged Type-1 hypervisor that can execute commodity virtual machines, which communicate over a low-latency and high-throughput software-defined optical network. To evaluate its novel approach, dRedBox will demonstrate application execution in the domains of network functions virtualization, infrastructure analytics, and real-time video surveillance.

publications.summary: This paper introduced new debugging principles and techniques for parallel programs which use transactional memory for shared memory synchronization.

publications.title: QuakeTM: Parallelizing a Complex Serial Application Using Transactional Memory
publications.source: ICS' 09: International Conference on Supercomputing
publications.summary: Practical experience of using transactional memory in real complex application, the Quake Game server. The approach in this paper takes a serial version of the Quake Game server and parallelizes it using OpenMP and transactional memory. Our findings suggest that transactional memory is a promising concurrency control mechanism which makes parallel programming on shared memory model much easier than locks. However, existing software implementations should improve in order to catch up with the performance of locks.

publications.title: Atomic quake: using transactional memory in an interactive multiplayer game server
publications.source: PPoPP' 09: ACM SIGPLAN Symposium on Principles and Practice of Parallel Programming.
publications.summary: Practical experience of using transactional memory in real complex application, the Quake Game server. The approach in this work takes an already parallelized version of the Quake Game server and replaces all lock-based synchronization with transactional memory. Our findings suggest that transactional memory is a promising concurrency control mechanism which makes parallel programming on shared memory model much easier than locks. However, existing software implementations should improve in order to catch up with the performance of locks.

headline: Global CIO | CTO | Cloud & Digital Transformation Leader | Driving Trading Tech, Risk Analytics & Enterprise Architecture at Scale (€40M Budgets | 150+ Global Teams)
jobTitle: Global CIO | Lead Engineer for Rates & Credit
about:
I am a global CIO/CTO with 20+ years of experience leading large-scale digital transformations in financial services. My career spans leadership roles at Santander, AWS, BBVA, and Credit Suisse, where I’ve built high-performance trading infrastructures, driven cloud adoption, and guided cross-continental teams through complex technology transformations.

What I do best:
• Technology Leadership at Scale – Direct global IT organizations of 150+ professionals across 10+ countries, managing €40M+ budgets while aligning IT strategy with business goals.
• Cloud & Digital Transformation – Led 80% cloud migration programs, cutting infrastructure costs by 20% while delivering next-generation e-trading and risk systems.
• Trading & Risk Platforms – Delivered high-performance, low-latency systems that improved trade throughput by 30% and accelerated risk calculations by 40%.
• Enterprise Architecture & Governance – Established global standards for microservices, DevOps, and security, ensuring regulatory compliance across Europe and the US.
• Thought Leadership & Innovation – Presented at AWS re:Invent and industry forums on cloud-native trading, real-time analytics, and digital banking.

I combine executive vision with hands-on technical depth, enabling me to partner with boards, regulators, and front-office leaders while inspiring engineering teams to innovate.

I’m passionate about leveraging technology to unlock business growth, reduce costs, and strengthen resilience in highly regulated environments.

experiences.title: Global CIO | Lead Engineer for Rates & Credit
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Lead a global IT organization of 150+ staff across 10+ countries, managing €40M+ annual budget for Fixed Income trading platforms.
	•	Directed 80% cloud migration of legacy systems → reduced infra costs by 20% while boosting scalability.
	•	Delivered a Cloud-Native E-Trading platform, increasing trade throughput by 30% and accelerating price discovery.
	•	Partnered with quant teams to re-architect pricing frameworks → improved risk calc speed by 40%.
	•	Fostered a DevOps culture: deployment frequency up 45%, rollback incidents cut by half.
	•	Represented Santander at AWS re:Invent, showcasing trading cloud transformation strategy.

experiences.title: Chief Architect for CIB Global Markets
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Established global architecture standards (microservices, CI/CD, containers) → cut code duplication 25%, sped time-to-market 30%.
	•	Spearheaded multi-region AWS & Azure migrations (Calypso, Murex) → reduced infra spend by 20%.
	•	Launched a Global Architecture Review Board, aligning compliance, governance, and security frameworks.
	•	Built a next-gen data lake for near real-time risk analytics, improving executive decision-making.

experiences.title: Principal Solutions Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
•	First FS-specialist SA in Southern Europe; advised CIOs/CTOs at Tier-1 banks on cloud adoption, compliance, and security.
	•	Designed end-to-end migrations of trading applications → reduced ops overhead by 35%.
	•	Piloted HPC for Monte Carlo simulations, cutting risk model runtimes by 40%.
	•	Led AI/ML roadmaps (fraud detection, automated pricing) with AWS Sagemaker, EMR.
	•	Mentored new SA hires, shaped FS practice, and contributed to AWS whitepapers & summits.

experiences.title: Head of Low Latency, Execution & Innovation
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Built an innovation-driven culture → delivered blockchain app for multi-million syndicated loans (faster settlement, transparency).
	•	Partnered with fintechs & vendors → reduced HFT transaction times by 30%.
	•	Oversaw team of 25 engineers & product managers, embedding agile best practices.

experiences.title: Head of Low Latency, Execution Architecure & Big Data
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Designed BBVA’s first enterprise-wide Big Data Architecture (Kafka streaming, distributed storage).
	•	Integrated HPC clusters for risk → overnight batch reduced 50%.
	•	Led cross-asset execution platforms (low-latency messaging, FIX engines, algo containers) → improved execution 40%.

experiences.title: Head of Low Latency
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Founded low-latency architecture practice → awarded Best Trading System internationally.
	•	Built algo-trading container reducing latency 25%, fueling revenue growth.
	•	Developed specialist engineering pipeline to sustain performance edge.

experiences.title: Transformation Manager
experiences.jobDescription: I managed a transformation program to optimize the risk and pricing system for investment banking. The global program included building an enterprise strategy for the bank, including optimization of distributed data centres, team structure, support and development processes, etc.

experiences.title: Senior Consultant
experiences.jobDescription: I managed several projects for this investment banking focused financial consultancy. I had a senior role with delivery responsibility for several projects in the technical consultancy space, some listed above but also including the development of a architecture for a spread betting company, technology consulting for a commodity trading company, etc.

experiences.title: Project Lead
experiences.jobDescription: I was the project lead to develop a new Enterprise grid capability. I coordinated the effort to develop new quant models, global data centre roll-out across Asia and Europe, creation of support and development teams, etc. The enterprise grid project was one of the first executed in London investment banking.

experiences.title: Infrastructure Architect
experiences.jobDescription: At Hewlett Packard I was employed as an IT infrastructure architect, designing and implementing advanced IT architectures at Hewlett Packard Laboratories in Bristol. In this position I lead the introduction of a utility computing centre and the creation of a flexible computing resource.

I was hired to manage the IT department and the growing need for a reliable production platform. I was predominantly focused on the design and management of the production systems and development platforms.

headline: COO & Co-Founder at Ralabs
about: I was supposed to be either a doctor or someone creative, but I became an engineer and entrepreneur – and I don’t regret it. I combine creativity, an engineering mindset, smart people, and lots of energy – and something great always comes out of it. I’m driven by speaking with smart people and always taking lessons from everyone!

experiences.title: Co-Founder, Chief Operating Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Ralabs is 150 people, mostly across the EU & Ukraine, but also with some great software engineering talents from LATAM (Brazil, Colombia, and etc). We managed to keep less 10% annual employees retention and high both employees and customers satisfaction scores.

When Ralabs grew, we went through several organizational changes and put more focus on structure and department coordination. We became a data-driven company with mature delivery processes, while still keeping our experimental culture and strong focus on self-learning and team growth. We hire the best talent and position ourselves as T-shaped experts with deep experience in a few key industries (Healthcare, Real Estate, and Logistics). We are proud of our strong top & middle management teams, and of our culture where "processes" are shaped around client needs.

experiences.title: Co-Founder, Chief Technology Officer
experiences.jobDescription: Ralabs was founded by two engineers, Andrew and me, with a simple idea – to create the best possible working environment for software engineers. From day zero, we focused on people first (building strong relationships with clients and employees), we believe on long-term partnerships, on self-ownership, working with passion and energy, and building trust through transparency. In the first two years, we began collaborations with Fortune 500 company, Forbes itself, and Bay Area startups – collaborations we continue today.

experiences.title: Co-Founder
experiences.jobDescription: Ten-Factors is a standard for preventing and reducing software risks, improving software team productivity, and enhancing software quality. It provides a clear framework for software improvement and business decision-making, and helps companies evaluate their software engineering practices across key areas.

experiences.title: n8n Ambassador & Enterprise AI Automation Consultant
experiences.jobDescription: Consulting on n8n Cloud & self-hosted automations, AI agents, custom MCP servers, and production-ready scalable workflows, plus training for enterprise teams. Consulted Upwork Enterprise (UPWK on Nasdaq) on AI agents, along with many other startups and businesses. Developed custom solutions such as https://www.npmjs.com/package/n8n-nodes-runn for partners https://runn.io.

experiences.title: Organizer, NodeSchool Lviv
experiences.jobDescription: NodeSchool is an offline practical workshop for those who want to learn Node.js. I organized NodeSchool Lviv with 7 mentors and 100+ attendees. We gave away 20 top engineering books to fast learners during the meetup to encourage further growth.

experiences.title: Technical Advisor
experiences.jobDescription: REW Consulting Services works with Fortune 500 and global organizations to define requirements, build product roadmaps, and automate outcomes. Our experts have automated some of the largest data centers using modern technologies and processes. We follow 2–3 week sprints to stay aligned with customers and deliver production-ready code that brings real business value.

We graduated more 500 students per year, with 80% NPS of students We build a community of ex students, and keep sharing technical knowledge across community.

updates.postText:
My article on managerial challenges during the war is out on Harvard Business Review about Ralabs

https://lnkd.in/eswUQv-a

#ukraine #softwaredevelopment #management

I've recently been invited to join Lotem (Israel-based consultancy) and Tal Koren in Israel to discuss how businesses can prepare for uncertain times, such as war or pandemics. More than 120 people attended.

I shared what actions did Ralabs take in 2022 to ensure our team & and business felt safe during uncertain periods. I hope this information can benefit companies in Israel and elsewhere. I honestly wish everyone safety and a swift return to peace!

I'm invited to share with Israel's startups and businesses about our strategies at Ralabs which helped to keep business continuity and stable deliverables, and as a result - satisfied clients and employees.

I'm inviting everyone from Israel or everyone who cooperates with Israel in one way or another - https://lnkd.in/e6XXJq-g.

Israel's business environment going through a difficult time, so I'm happy to be helpful to the IT and business community.

publications.title: A Cofounder of Ralabs on Leading a Ukrainian Start-Up Through a Year of War
publications.source: HBR
publications.summary: Learn from Ralabs' success story in navigating the invasion crisis. Our proactive business continuity planning and decisive decision-making led to a quick recovery, achieving 90% performance within weeks. Gain valuable insights on scenario planning, adaptability, and effective crisis management to empower your organization in uncertain times. #CrisisManagement #BusinessContinuity #Leadership

publications.title: Leading a Business in Ukraine During the War
publications.source: HBR
publications.summary: As the world marks the one-year anniversary of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, this article shares first-hand stories from a diverse group of Ukrainian business leaders. Their experiences provide a glimpse into the challenges of leading in the midst of war, and offer lessons on the power of resilience, purpose, empathy, and gratitude — no matter how hopeless things may appear.

headline: Global Alliance CTO @ KPMG | Driving Microsoft Technology Innovation
about:
As the Global CTO of the Microsoft Alliance at KPMG, I lead the strategy, sales, and delivery of solutions that leverage Microsoft's cloud, data, and AI capabilities to transform our clients' business. With over 20 years of experience in enterprise software, I am a passionate engineer and technologist dedicated to helping organizations deliver innovation and value using Microsoft technologies.

I specialize in creative ideation, solution architecture, and enterprise IT strategy. My strong track record includes building high-performance teams, influencing and connecting across all levels of an organization, and solving complex problems with resourcefulness and excellence. I hold an MSc in Computer Engineering, along with multiple Microsoft certifications and awards, including the Microsoft MVP and MCT. Additionally, I am a member of the British Computer Society and the Colexio Profesional de Enxeñaría en Informática.

Driven by the mission of enabling digital transformation and innovation for our clients and partners, I focus on delivering solutions that create positive impact and outcomes. I am always eager to learn and explore new technologies and business models that disrupt and challenge the status quo.

experiences.title: Global Director Microsoft Alliance in Financial Services
CTO Microsoft Business Solutions
experiences.jobDescription: As part of the leadership team I help to plan and execute HCL's strategy for Business Solutions across the Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Azure platforms with a focus on defining the right solutions, verticals and partnerships to deliver the maximum value for our customers.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.jobDescription: My primary role at PowerObjects is to lead the R&D organization and create value for our customers by building reusable IP and industry solutions with Microsoft Dynamics 365, and all the Microsoft Cloud technologies.

experiences.title: Customer Management Platform Architect
experiences.jobDescription:
My mission at Metro Bank was to support the accelerated growth of the bank by delivering technology innovation across the Customer Management Platform. Working in an agile environment with a close alignment with the business stakeholders, we successfully uncovered several key areas for improvement. We identified potential innovative solutions to create a technology roadmap for the bank.

One of the key areas was the rationalisation and improvement of the customer experience across digital and telephone communication channels. I identified tactical savings in the contact centre, delivering 15% performance improvement, spanned into a much bigger technology transformation programme.

experiences.title: Senior Partner Technology Strategist
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Partner Technology Strategist, I was responsible for the Readiness of the Microsoft Dynamics Partner community in the UK and supporting Microsoft sales teams in key customer engagements where technical solution architecture skills were required.

I became a trusted advisor for the partner community by building relationships with partner's leadership teams and demonstrating the value-added that I could bring to their businesses. I helped design go-to-market strategies and business plans, supported vertical solutions design and introduced technology innovation across the channel. New licence revenue contribution from managed partners grew by more than 100%.

I also worked with the Microsoft Dynamics Global Partner teams to design and develop new tools and approaches to increase the readiness of the partner community, mentoring other team members across subsidiaries.

experiences.title: CRM Technical Lead
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Technical Lead for Barclays Wealth CRM project, I had responsibility for a team of developers delivering a Wealth Management Solution for more than 4,000 users in 22 countries using Microsoft Dynamics CRM as a platform.

Despite numerous technical challenges and very aggressive deadlines, my team successfully delivered the project on time and on a budget to support the Gamma innovation programme for Barclays Wealth. During the critical phases, I managed to keep the team focused and extremely efficient by providing leadership and ensuring that every member was utilised to its full potential and introducing best practices for continuous integration and software delivery. 

The role involved workshops and collaboration with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure that the technical team properly understood all the requirements and the business cases clearly identified to guarantee that the project covered the top priorities. We achieved more than a 20% productivity increase for private bankers, improved customer retention and delivered regulatory compliance.

experiences.title: Head of Development & Pre-Sales
experiences.jobDescription:
As a head of development I was responsible for mentoring and coaching a team of developers specialised on complex customisations and extensions over the Microsoft Dynamics platform. I took full ownership of the workload, coordinating the team deliverables and providing technical leadership. During this period I doubled the size of the team and successfully cross-trained developers into Microsoft Dynamics.

As part of my role I was frequently involved in customer engagements where deep technical solution expertise was required. I regularly delivered customer workshops with senior decision makers across technology to provide guidance on Microsoft Dynamics CRM implementations across Financial Services, Public Sector, Commercial and Professional Services.

Aside from my internal responsibilities, I worked with Microsoft DPE as the Microsoft CRM Developer trainer of reference for EMEA and the Microsoft Metro program, training more than 200 developers across Europe.

experiences.title: Senior Technical Consultant
experiences.jobDescription:
Working as Microsoft Dynamics Technical consultant at one of the major UK banks. 
Involved on the design of integrations with back end systems for the Business Banking area, and developed advanced user interfaces.

Trainer and Consultant on Microsoft Technologies for major Spanish Companies on Banking & Financial, Professional Services , IT and Public sectors.
Developer Lead on Microsoft Dynamics CRM implementation for several Spanish First Division  football teams ("La Liga").

updates.postText:
Heading back home after an inspiring few days at our KPMG  Lakehouse! It was an absolute privilege to connect with colleagues, analysts, clients, and partners during our Global Analyst Day. We shared our success stories and ambitious global strategy—showcasing how we’re moving fast, acting boldly, and embracing responsibility in this deep transformational era powered by AI.

I’m especially proud of our groundbreaking technology innovations and the strong partnership we’ve built with Microsoft  Together, we’re driving initiatives that not only accelerate our growth but also enhance the value we deliver to every client. The future is bright, and I’m excited for all the remarkable possibilities our alliance will unlock.

Here’s to continuous innovation and a trusted journey ahead!

#GlobalAnalystDay #Innovation #DigitalTransformation #Microsoft #KPMG

Really proud to share that KPMG has launched Workbench, our foundational multi-agent AI platform built on Microsoft Azure AI Foundry. This isn't just another tool—it’s shaping how we work and serve clients every day.

What’s great about it:

📌50+ intelligent AI assistants live, with hundreds more in the pipeline—designed to collaborate not just with humans, but with each other to streamline complex client tasks 

📌Data sovereignty baked in—our clients stay in full control of how their data is stored and processed, aligned with global compliance standards 

📌Interoperable with Microsoft, Oracle, Salesforce, ServiceNow, Workday, and more, enabling teams to connect to other systems and choose suitable AI models or agents.

📌Trusted AI by design—we’re the first to earn ISO 42001 certification, and every agent is framed by our 10-pillar Trusted AI Framework 

Workbench is already helping streamline identity checks at a global bank, boost compliance in telecoms, and automate back-office work for retailers. Quoting Judson Althoff (Microsoft Chief Commercial Officer):

“KPMG Workbench represents a transformative step in AI-driven collaboration, integrating multi-agent intelligence into a centralized platform leveraging Azure AI Foundry. This investment is more than just technological innovation – it’s a pivotal move toward the future of the open agentic web.”

For me, this isn’t about shiny tech—it’s about bringing together powerful AI and our deep human expertise to deliver smarter, faster, and more trusted solutions. Proud of what we’ve built—and excited to see where it helps us go next.

#KPMG #AI #Innovation #Microsoft #Alliances

Recently, KPMG celebrated its #ValuesWeek, and it got me thinking about what I appreciate most about working here. As someone who's been part of the KPMG family for almost five years, I've had countless experiences to choose from, but one stands out above the rest: the power of Together. Working with Microsoft to help our network reach new heights has shown me just how much we can achieve when we collaborate as a team. 

#togetherforbetter  #gratitude #teamcollaboration #teamappreciation #boldleadership

I had a wonderful time at the Microsoft Global MVP summit. It is exciting to see all the great products and technology innovation. However, the best part of this event is always catching up with old friends and making new ones. After 3 years of online only versions due to Covid, it is great to see that the MVP community is still strong in-person. Thank  to my colleagues and fellow MVPs for making it so special, and to KPMG for supporting us.

 #microsoft #technology #innovation #community #mvpbuzz #mvpsummit #kpmgalliances #kpmgproud

Scaling #GenAI solutions is no easy task. There are so many more nuances than people often expect. Beyond the usual challenges of scaling enterprise apps, there are unique aspects to consider, like the complexities of natural language interactions, heightened security concerns, and cost management, to name just a few.

A few weeks ago, Mario Trueba Cantero and I had the chance to share our insights on this topic at the MelaTech conference in Malta. Below, I've included a quick overview of some of the key issues we discussed.

What makes this technology especially unique is that it’s not deterministic, and it’s driven by natural language. This brings both exciting opportunities and tough challenges. For example, the same flexibility that lets us achieve incredible outcomes with smart prompt engineering also makes handling things like prompt injection and content filtering tricky.

As David Hurtado Torán mentioned in a recent post (link in comments), this field is evolving at breakneck speed and expectations are changing fast. It’s not going anywhere, and ignoring it simply isn’t an option.

It feels like we’re at the very beginning of scaling GenAI, just like in the early 2000s when the internet was taking off and it was the Wild West of SQL injection. There’s a lot to learn, and it’s an exciting time to be part of this journey.

What do you think? I’d love to hear your thoughts on where GenAI is headed and the challenges to scale it.

publications.title: "Oculus Rift in Action" reviewer

publications.summary: Reviewer of the first book about Oculus Rift: "Oculus Rift in Action"

publications.title: How do new visual immersive systems influence gaming QoE? A use case of serious gaming with Oculus Rift
publications.source: IEEE
publications.summary: The recent introduction in the market of low cost yet high fidelity head-mounted displays with stereoscopic 3D perspective such as Oculus Rift opens the door to novel virtual reality experiences for gaming. However, QoE metrics and methodologies for this kind of platforms are still unexplored. In this paper, a comparative study on how these novel displays impact gaming QoE with regard to conventional 2D PC screens is presented. Through an experiment where we invited 22 users to play with a virtual forklift driving serious game in both environments, we demonstrate that Oculus broadly increases the sense of immersion in the 3D world as well as perceived game usability. Affective factors are also deeply impacted by this platform that shoots up amazement, astonishment and excitement levels. Nevertheless, a worrying aspect is the high percentage of persons that report feelings of nausea after wearing the goggles.

publications.title: Simuladores y Entornos inmersivos de bajo de coste para Operaciones Especiales
publications.source: CDESEID 2014
publications.summary: En el adiestramiento de misiones de Operaciones Especiales (OEs), uno de los aspectos fundamentales es el acceso a la información del objetivo de la forma más rápida y fiable posible. La integración de diferentes fuentes de información (mapas 3D de la zona, modelos de las estructuras y edificios, modelos atmosféricos, fotografías de baja resolución...), su actualización en tiempo real durante la planificación, así como la disminución drástica del tiempo necesario para su generación y puesta a disposición de las órganos de planeamiento, se configuran como objetivos fundamentales. Siguiendo los conceptos de la MT 6.5.2 del ETID, se eligió como herramienta de integración un motor gráfico comercial de altas prestaciones, multiplataforma y multiusuario, que permitía reducir enormemente los costes de desarrollo y de despliegue en cualquiera de los dispositivos existentes, tanto de escritorio como móviles. Además, existe la opción de utilizar el protocolo HLA para interoperabilidad de simuladores, lo que permite la comunicación con simuladores del tipo VBS2 del ET. La prueba de concepto realizada con la EMMOE y el Mando de Operaciones Especiales (MOE) ha seguido metodologías ágiles para disponer de prototipos funcionales lo más rápidamente posible, así como para incorporar las mejoras extraídas del juicio critico de los usuarios finales tras las pruebas; tanto desde el punto de vista de mandos y profesores, como de los miembros de los equipos operativos y los alumnos.

publications.title: Integración de Simulaciones en Entornos de Visualización Inmersiva
publications.source: DESEi+d 2014
publications.summary: Este trabajo presenta las acciones que estamos realizando para crear una herramienta de generación y ejecución de entornos virtuales y simulación altamente inmersivos de bajo coste. El objetivo de la herramienta es que usuarios no expertos definan entornos de simulación combinando aplicaciones de M&S y dispositivos COTS con un reducido coste operacional. La integración de aplicaciones de M&S se basa en HLA (High Level Architecture). Este estándar es soportado por numerosos simuladores y garantiza la interoperabilidad, distribución y sincronización de sus ejecuciones en tiempo real. En particular, su implementación por distintos Game Engines (GEs) permite que la capa de interacción con usuario aproveche las ventajas ofrecidas por estos (mulitplataforma y multiusuario) pero fundamentalmente la incorporación de nuevos dispositivos de interacción multimodal de bajo coste. La combinación de herramientas de M&S y GEs permite que los escenarios generados sean unos serious games cada vez más realistas y por lo tanto de mayor aplicabilidad para el entrenamiento en los ámbitos militar (meta tecnológica 6.5.2 del ETID) y civil. Contribuyen, por lo tanto, a la reducción de costes y riesgos implícitos en la ejecución de determinados ejercicios. A pesar de la calidad y especialización de los simuladores existentes, así como, del grado de inmersión generado por los GEs y los dispositivos actuales, siguen existiendo oportunidades de mejora. Este trabajo presenta dos: el servicio de terrenos correlados con alta precisión en tiempo real y la Síntesis de Sonido 3D (SS3D) en tiempo real. Se analiza también la influencia que la calidad de la descripción del terreno tiene en la SS3D, en particular, en la simulación de sonido en campo cercano.

headline: Technology Leader, currently Director of Engineering, Social at Superbet
about:
I believe in technology’s power to transform organizations into more effective organisms, uniting human and technical resources to catapult growth. I’m a performance-driven leader with 17 years of experience in creating and leading high-performance, cross-functional technology teams. My competencies are people, budget, change and stakeholder management, program delivery and digital transformation.

As a leader, I seek to create an open environment where people are encouraged to speak their mind and take initiatives. I also focus on the growth of my team, which translates into very low attrition. I’m a life-long self-learner with a creative mindset, looking to merge my passions and my work.

experiences.title: Software Development Manager (SDM) @ Amazon Optics
experiences.jobDescription: Led the engineering team from the inception of the Amazon Optics vertical through launch.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
My role as CTO of Bnext is to steer the company's technological strategy, translating the board's and executive committee's vision into a tactical approach to be implemented by the technology teams. In my role, I am part of the fundraising management presentations, where I present to active and potential investors the company's technology strategy in order to secure funding.

During my tenure I have grown the technology team from three people to over thirty staff across mobile, data, development and infrastructure. Other key achievements: we delivered the Mexico launch project in just 14 weeks, and I was part of the three-person team that obtained Bnext's Spanish electronic money issuer license in 14 months, the fastest license awarded by the regulator in Spain to date.

experiences.title: IT Resilience Manager EMEA / Head of IT Spain
experiences.jobDescription:
• Enforced resilience policies & testing calendars across 16 countries. 
• Managed a technical delivery team of 22 staff based in Europe and India to support the development of in-country resilience programs (business continuity plans, building power-downs and branch continuity tests). 
• Planned and managed the Spanish branch divestment, leveraging agile methodologies to deliver 18 months of work within 3.5 months and realizing 40% of savings in headcount, contract and supply.

experiences.title: Head of IT Spain & Portugal
experiences.jobDescription:
• Managed a €2.2M budget and a team of 19 in Spain and Portugal. 
• Took over central contract vendor negotiations, leading to a 20% cost reduction with no impact on performance KPIs. 
• Delivered all Bank of Spain regulatory reporting with a 100% compliance. 
• Managed Europe-wide IT transformation projects.

experiences.title: IT Manager for Spain and Portugal
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed the largest acquisition in the history of the finance industry between RBS and ABN AMRO (combined £1.9 trillion in assets)   
• Managed all technology aspects of the merger (people, processes, systems), leading to a new organization of 330 employees in Spain and 30 in Portugal. 
• Unified regulatory reporting platforms.

experiences.title: Lisbon and Madrid Technology Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Successfully set up a new branch within a €400K budget and within schedule: 
• Met with regulators to develop a thorough understanding of compliance requirements affecting operations, reporting and systems. 
• Met with local vendors to secure compliance with local legal requirements regarding data protection, anti-money laundering and Politically Exposed Persons. 
• Set up branch infrastructure (office building equipment). 
• Set up a remote support desk with 120 staff members based in India.

experiences.title: IT Support Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
• Set up IT support for the Madrid branch (65 employees).  
• Hired and managed 2 Support Engineers. 
• Designed and implemented new processes to support users from the trading floor, corporate and back office on approx. 100 systems.

experiences.title: Infrastructure Project Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Core services and networking project manager.

recommendationsReceived.name: Maciej Muras
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Software Engineer
recommendationsReceived.context: Maciej reported directly to Alvaro
recommendationsReceived.description:
Over the past two years, Alvaro has been an exceptional manager and an inspiring leader. From the outset, he made sure our team was clear on expectations and focused on our objectives, always helping us navigate challenges without losing sight of our goals. Alvaro’s empathetic approach fostered a supportive environment, whether by offering encouragement or by redistributing tasks to keep our workload manageable during demanding periods.

His commitment to celebrating our contributions stood out—he consistently made our efforts visible and ensured we received the recognition we deserved. Beyond his role as a manager, Alvaro has been instrumental in shaping the strategic direction of our project. His vision and business acumen have driven revenue growth while providing new opportunities for our team to advance and expand their skills. Alvaro’s leadership has left a lasting impact, both on our project’s success and on our individual growth.

recommendationsReceived.description: I have had the great pleasure to be part of Alvaro’s Tech team at Bnext. He is a great professional and an outstanding leader with impressive management skills. During that time he was always supportive, helped me to develop as a professional and created a healthy team climate where we were encourage to perform while learning and challenge ourselves. His natural skills and in-depth expertise as a CTO was key for the success of the most complex projects in the Data department. Any organization would be lucky to have Alvaro as their manager. This is the person who has become for me an ideal for people oriented leadership.

recommendationsReceived.name: Eriberto G.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Technical Product Management Senior Leader, AI Consultant | Amazon | Blizzard | AppFolio
recommendationsReceived.context: Eriberto worked with Alvaro on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description:
Throughout almost 2 decades of professional career, I have had the chance to meet hundreds of colleagues. I can safely say that Alvaro is at the top of the list. 

He is an outstanding leader with extensive management knowledge. He understands how to lead, empower, and inspire people be the best version of themselves. 

With a wide set of skills that ranges from hard technical skills, to venture valuations, org structuring, employee performance management, and more he is certainly an asset any company would be extremely lucky to have. 

I hope that in the future I am blessed to work with him again.

recommendationsReceived.name: David Sánchez-Camacho García
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Growth and Product Consultant
recommendationsReceived.context: David worked with Alvaro but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description:
Alvaro is the perfect balance between a professional and human being that you want to have around.

On a professional level, I truly believe he is one of the most hard-working, empathetic and outstanding people I know. I have been lucky enough to work on projects with him, being provided with solutions for everything I needed from him and proposing alternatives (yes, in the plural) for those others that could not be answered in the short term. 

On a human level, he is probably one of the best managers I have ever met. Not only does he manage their teams with superb human quality, but I have had the immense pleasure of having him share with me (and the rest of the young managers in the company) his tricks, advice and ways of proceeding for an infinite number of situations he had faced before. Training for which we would have to pay an important amount in case it was formal, but that he has decided to share with a group of the company, with the only desire to prepare us and make us better. 

And for all this, I know that Álvaro is a "must" in any team. Not only for the knowledge and leadership ability of technological teams but for the aura and skills he brings to all those who are close to him. 

If I had to summarize it in a few words, I would say that Alvaro is VITAL in any organization that wants to have a team balanced between performance and healthy company culture.

recommendations.name: Aftab Alam
recommendations.subtitle: Technical Program Manager at Amazon (AWS, Retail) - (Certified SAA, TOGAF, PMP) - experienced in Program Delivery with Solution Design
recommendations.context: Alvaro managed Aftab directly
recommendations.description:
While working at Amazon as an SDM, I had the pleasure of working with Aftab as TPM for a new, confidential product initiative at Amazon. Aftab was a cornerstone in driving our program operations forward. His ability to manage multiple workstreams simultaneously is remarkable, as evidenced in his ownership of the program's most important stakeholder reporting and tracking mechanisms, covering more than 10 workstreams across Tech, Business, and Retail.

Aftab demonstrated exceptional ownership in the project workstreams the he delivered, owning Finance, Tax, and Accounting work, as well as our internal security certification - detail-driven integrations, without which our project would not have been ready for launch. He also owned setting up and executing our internal testing strategies, driving phased testing for our initial MLP launch in Feb. '24 

Beyond his technical skills, Aftab drove strategic alignment with partner teams (InfoSec, Tax, Accounting, Finance, Fulfilment and external suppliers), and coordinated work between them and our engineering team. He was diligent in flagging issues and proactive in resolving them, escalating them when appropriate.

I really enjoyed working with Aftab: he is smart, dedicated, kind and easy to work with. I recommend him for roles that require technical acumen, program management skills, and a commitment to getting things done! He would make an awesome addition to any team.

headline: Global VP | Cloud & IT GTM Portfolio & Innovation Strategy | Tech Visionary | Driving Business Transformation Across Global Industries | DBA Researcher
jobTitle: Global VP of Cloud and IT Solutions (Portfolio, Innovation & Marketing Strategy)
about:
A powerhouse at the intersection of tech leadership and academic rigor, I serve as Vice President of Cloud & IT Go-to-Market (GTM) Portfolio and Innovation Strategy at Marlink Group, where I lead the global transformation of the business into a modern, AI-powered Managed Services Provider (MSP) and Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) model. With over 30 years of experience in digital transformation, I’ve architected secure, scalable cloud and IT ecosystems that drive real-world impact across maritime, energy, enterprise, government, cybersecurity, and humanitarian sectors.
🔹 At Marlink, I design and execute cloud-first, AI-ready GTM strategies across business units, leading high-performing teams to accelerate Total Contract Value (TCV) growth and operational efficiency.
🔹 My leadership integrates cloud computing, AI infrastructure, cybersecurity, DevOps modernization, modern workplace and data governance into cohesive offerings aligned to industry needs and sovereign digital requirements.
🔹 Previously held executive leadership roles at Core42, E-Hosting Datafort, and NTT Data, where I drove revenue-generating GTM initiatives, built CoEs, and led cross-functional teams delivering $750M+ in impact across sales, delivery, and innovation streams.
My work blends technical depth, business acumen, and academic insight. As a Doctoral Candidate in Business Administration (DBA), I’m exploring how innovation and consumer behavior shape GTM strategies for UAE technology services companies — reinforcing my commitment to future-forward leadership at the edge of strategy and execution.
Whether scaling platforms, developing CoEs, leading cloud-native transformations, or building strategic alliances, my passion lies in turning vision into value through technology-driven growth and sustainable impact.
My experience spans sales, pre-sales, enterprise architecture, product management, and post-sales delivery, where I established Centers of Excellence (CoE) teams to drive scalable delivery, operations and to foster technological innovation. These initiatives enhanced operational and financial efficiencies and catalyzed business growth and organizational change.
Academically, I am pursuing a Doctor of Business Administration (DBA), specializing in Leadership Strategy and Marketing, complementing my postgraduate Master’s Degree in Information Systems Management (MBA for IT). This fusion of practical expertise and academic knowledge allows me to lead strategically and forward-thinking, ensuring technology-driven innovation that translates into long-term organizational success.

•	Directly influencing the consolidation of legacy systems into modernized platforms, significantly contributing to Marlink's digital transformation towards a modern managed service provider globally.

headline: Data & Cloud Platforms Director
about:
Digital Architect and Cloud Platforms Director with more than 20 years of experience designing, deploying, and managing IT solutions and services. I have comprehensive knowledge and an in-depth understanding of IT infrastructure, Hybrid Cloud Solutions, and modern software development with a lot of experience in team-building and digital transformation in high-regulated sectors.

Especially focused on Digital platforms, Data Analytics, Cloud architecture, and implementing new Operating Models to deliver mission-critical solutions in global enterprises.

experiences.title: Head of Enterprise Architecture
experiences.jobDescription:
At Roche Diabetes Care R&D, we are committed to supporting our organization in enabling diabetes condition management for our patients. We are a global function that operates from Barcelona to the whole world, providing services to 40 countries and more than 5500 people distributed all over the globe.

I am leading a multidisciplinary architecture team in charge of defining a new digital architecture that enables the digital strategy of the company. Developing new web and mobile apps, integrating hardware devices, building a new digital platform and leveraging cloud analytic capabilities to build B2B/B2B2C solutions that provide true relief to our patients in a global and massive environment. Our priority is to deliver digital solutions in an agile way but always ensuring the security and our Patient´s privacy and meeting the most demanding regulations: GDPR, HIPAA, France HDS and ISO 13485 Medical Device.

Microservices and Event-Driven Architecture, AWS,  Micro Frontend with React, iOS&Android native apps, NodeJS/Java, HL7/FHIR, MuleSoft API Manager, OpenID/OAuth2, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Mongo NoSQL DB, Big Data architectures, SAP Customer Data Cloud (Gigya), Salesforce Commerce Cloud  and Agile/SAFE Methodologies

headline: AI and automation developer
about:
🌟 Más de 10 años convirtiendo 𝐼𝒹𝑒𝒶𝓈 en ʀᴇᴀʟɪᴅᴀᴅ | Desarrollador Autodidacta y Creativo 🌐

🔥 Empecé mi viaje en el mundo de la programación a los 14 años, explorando PAWN, Lua y Java para crear contenido y servidores para videojuegos. De esta pasión nació mi primera comunidad de jugadores con 5 servidores y cientos de usuarios diarios.

🚀 Mi sed de conocimiento me impulsó a desarrollar mis propios videojuegos en Unity, Unreal Engine y Game Maker, dominando C#, JavaScript y GML. Utilizando mi experiencia en motores gráficos, desarrollé tours virtuales para proyectos urbanísticos, entornos virtuales conectados a Web APIs con actualización en tiempo real, y publiqué videojuegos en la Play Store de Google y assets en los principales mercados.

🌐 Para llevar mis proyectos al mundo digital, dominé el desarrollo web (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, jQuery, Bootstrap, Vue.js...), gestioné bases de datos (SQL, MySQL, MongoDB...), desarrollé APIs y programas (.NET Core 6 y 7 C#), creé mis propias APPs (Xamarin, Flutter y DroidScript), aseguré la ciberseguridad y realicé pruebas de penetración en sitios web, redes y dispositivos (Kali Linux, PentestBox, Foca, Burpsuite...), además de diseño web y gráfico (Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva...) y optimización SEO (Google Analytics, SemRush, Metricool, Search Console...).
Estos proyectos los alojé y administré en AWS, Azure e Ionos con los sistemas operativos Windows, RedHat y Ubuntu.

💼 Mi conjunto de habilidades me permitió trabajar como freelance internacional y mentor, transformando ideas abstractas en proyectos exitosos con una calificación promedio de 5 estrellas en plataformas y agencias reconocidas.

🌍 La experiencia me brindó la oportunidad de colaborar con expertos, aprendiendo no solo aspectos técnicos, sino también la totalidad del ciclo de desarrollo y comercialización de un producto, desde la concepción hasta el lanzamiento.

🧠 Mi pasión por el aprendizaje continuo me impulsó a explorar nuevas tecnologías, incluyendo Redes Neuronales e Inteligencia Artificial Generativa (Python), Blockchain (Smart Contracts y Truffle), NFT y Metaverso. Creé ReadyForMetaverse.com, un portal que promueve el conocimiento del metaverso a través de eventos e Internet. En su primer año, logramos alrededor de 2 millones de impresiones y participamos como ponentes en más de 10 de los principales eventos del metaverso.

📧 ¡Contacta conmigo! Siempre estoy abierto a crear, participar, mentorizar o trabajar en nuevos proyectos.

#FullStack #Metaverso #NFT #DesarrolloWeb #Blockchain #AutoDidacta #Programador
